abstract: pmc bioRxiv 3848 biorxiv BIORXIV bioRxiv 2692-8205 Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Preprints PMC12478356 PMC12478356.1 12478356 12478356 41030963 10.1101/2024.07.26.605291 1 preprint 1 Article Development of a new flippase-dependent mouse model for red fluorescence-based isolation of Kras G12D Hrckulak Dusan http://orcid.org/0000-0002-1752-3612 Krausova Michaela Onhajzer Jakub http://orcid.org/0000-0001-6569-6836 Stastna Monika Kriz Vitezslav Janeckova Lucie http://orcid.org/0000-0003-0139-7065 Korinek Vladimir http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9777-4664 26 7 2024 497784 2024.07.26.605291 29 09 2025 30 09 2025 01 10 2025 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License http://biorxiv.org/lookup/doi/10.1101/2024.07.26.605291 nihpp-2024.07.26.605291.pdf Abstract Proto-oncogene KRAS, GTPase (KRAS) is one of the most intensively studied oncogenes in cancer research. Although several mouse models allow for regulated expression of mutant Kras, selective isolation and analysis of transforming or tumor cells that produce the Kras oncogene remains a challenge. In our study, we present a knock-in model of oncogenic variant Kras G12D G12D Kras RedRas Kras RR in vitro in vivo Flp Kras RR G12D G12D pmc-status-qastatus 0 pmc-status-live yes pmc-status-embargo no pmc-status-released yes pmc-prop-open-access yes pmc-prop-olf no pmc-prop-manuscript no pmc-prop-legally-suppressed no pmc-prop-has-pdf yes pmc-prop-has-supplement no pmc-prop-pdf-only no pmc-prop-suppress-copyright no pmc-prop-is-real-version yes pmc-prop-is-scanned-article no pmc-prop-preprint yes pmc-prop-in-epmc yes

metadata.Title of this paper: Development of a new flippase-dependent mouse model for red fluorescence-based isolation of Kras
